page.title: 18STORIES FROM NAILSTONE
page.content:
The story goes that an elderly lady, travelled regularly along an old cart road behind the Manor House which still stands in Church Road. One night the horse and cart wandered into a muddy hole and stuck fast. She was not willing to leave the horse and in the struggle to free it she lost her life.
The{Manor House}is said to have its own ghost. The Lord of the Manor is reputed to have fathered one of his woman servant's children. This birth out of wedlock meant that the mother Betty Baker could not be buried in the church yard when she eventually died. She was buried at the rear of the Manor House and it is said that some nights Betty Baker still walks inside the Manor. Who knows !
